H0.text: what is the name of the currency used in italy. Lira

H1.text: what is the name of the currency used in italy. Italian Pound

H2.text: what is the name of the currency used in italy. Italia

H3.text: what is the name of the currency used in italy. Euro

A4.text: The lira (LEER-ə, Italian: [ˈliːra]; pl. : lire, LEER-ay, Italian: [ˈliːre]) was the currency of Italy between 1861 and 2002.

A5.text: In 1999, the euro became Italy's unit of account and the lira became a national subunit of the euro at a rate of €1 = Lit 1,936.27, before being replaced as cash in 2002.

A6.text: The pre-euro banknotes of Italy (in English and German)
